dt: {bc}an arrangement of a body of troops with its units each somewhat to the left or right of the one in the rear like a series of steps
{bc}a formation of units or individuals resembling such an echelon
{bc}a flight formation in which each airplane flies at a certain elevation above or below and at a certain distance behind and to the right or left of the airplane ahead
{bc}any of several military units in echelon formation
{bc}any unit or group acting in a disciplined or organized manner
{bc}one of a series of levels or grades in an organization or field of activity
{bc}a group of individuals at a particular level or grade in an organization or field of activity

et: French {it}échelon{/it}, literally, rung of a ladder, from Old French {it}eschelon{/it}, from {it}eschele{/it} ladder, from Late Latin {it}scala{/it}
shortdef: an arrangement of a body of troops with its units each somewhat to the left or right of the one in the rear like a series of steps
a formation of units or individuals resembling such an echelon
a flight formation in which each airplane flies at a certain elevation above or below and at a certain distance behind and to the right or left of the airplane ahead

dt: {bc}to form or arrange in an echelon

shortdef: to form or arrange in an echelon
to take position in an echelon

dt: {bc}an element of a military headquarters or unit located at a considerable distance from the front and concerned especially with administrative and supply duties

shortdef: an element of a military headquarters or unit located at a considerable distance from the front and concerned especially with administrative and supply duties
